intro: Leptarrhena, commonly known as the silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, compound leaves and clusters of yellow or white flowers. Leptarrhena species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its seeds are also valued as a food source by local wildlife and some human populations.
